snippet: It was uncertain whether the transfer was intended to keep chemical weapons out of rebel hands or was for more sinister purposes, officials and analysts said.
abstract: Syria has started moving some parts of its huge stockpile of chemical weapons out of storage, but it is uncertain whether the transfer is a precaution as security conditions across the country rapidly deteriorate, or something more sinister; analysts are split in their opinions about whether Pres Bashar al-Assad might use chemical weapons against the rebels or is trying to prevent the arsenal from falling into rebel hands.

byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: It was uncertain whether the transfer was intended to keep chemical weapons out of rebel hands or was for more sinister purposes, officials and analysts said.

headline.seo: Syria Moves Some Chemical Weapons, U.S. Says
headline.main: Syria Moving Parts of Chemical Arsenal, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Syria Moving Parts of Chemical Arsenal, U.S. Says
